Package epiplex

Class PerformanceUtils

java.lang.Object
epiplex.PerformanceUtils
public class PerformanceUtils extends Object
The PerformanceUtils class provides utility methods to handle performance-related actions in the Epiplex500 application. It contains methods for starting a capture, clicking elements and waiting for specific elements to be displayed.

  • Method Details

    • startCapture

      public static void startCapture​(String fileName)
      Starts the capture process in the Epiplex500 application with the specified file name.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the capture file to be created.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the capture process.

    • cancelCapture

      public static void cancelCapture()
      Cancels the ongoing capture process in the Epiplex500 application, if it is in progress.

      This method cancels the ongoing capture by clicking the "Cancel" button on the capture progress screen and confirming the cancellation. If the capture process is not in progress, no action is taken.

      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while canceling the capture process.

    • saveCapture

      public static void saveCapture()
      Saves the ongoing capture in the Epiplex500 application, if it is in progress.

      This method saves the ongoing capture by clicking the "Save" button on the capture progress screen, handling any properties window that may appear, and waiting for the capture file to be saved. After the capture file is saved, it closes any pop-up windows that may appear and closes the Epiplex500 application.

      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while saving the capture.

    • finalizeFromHome

      public void finalizeFromHome​(String fileName)
      Finalizes the capture file with the given name from the Epiplex500 application's home screen.

      This method launches the Epiplex500 application, sets root search to true, and focuses on the Epiplex500 window. It then performs the necessary steps to finalize the capture file specified by the given fileName. The method searches for the capture file using the search functionality, right-clicks on the file, and selects the "Finalize" option. After finalizing the capture, it waits for the "Finalize Settings" window to be displayed and clicks the "OK" button. If prompted, it clicks the "Yes" button to confirm the action. After the capture file is finalized, it waits for the Developer Editor window to open and focuses on it.

      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the capture file to be finalized.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while finalizing the capture file from the home screen.

    • generateDocument

      public void generateDocument​(String fileName, String testCaseName)
      Generates a document in the Developer Editor and logs data during the process.

      This method generates a document in the Developer Editor with the given fileName and testCaseName. It focuses on the Developer Editor window and performs the following steps:

      1. Clicks on the "File" menu and selects "Generate Document..."
      2. Focuses on the "Generate Document" window
      3. Clicks on the "Settings" menu and selects "Load Settings..."
      4. Focuses on the "Open" window
      5. Enters the file name in the "File name:" field and presses Enter
      6. Focuses back on the "Generate Document" window
      7. Clicks on the "Generate" button to generate the document
      8. If a file overwrite confirmation dialog is displayed, clicks "Yes" to replace the file
      9. Waits for the document to be generated
      10. Stops the timer for logging the time taken for document generation
      11. Clicks on the "No" button to close any additional dialog boxes (if present)
      12. Sets root search to true
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the document file to be generated.
      testCaseName - The name of the test case being executed for logging purposes.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while generating the document in the Developer Editor.

    • generateSimulation

      public void generateSimulation​(String fileName, String testCaseName)
      Generates a simulation in the Developer Editor and logs data during the process.

      This method generates a simulation in the Developer Editor with the given fileName and testCaseName. It focuses on the Developer Editor window and performs the following steps:

      1. Clicks on the "File" menu and selects "Generate Simulation..."
      2. Focuses on the "Simulation Wizard" window
      3. Clicks on the "Settings" menu and selects "Load Settings..."
      4. Focuses on the "Open" window
      5. Enters the file name in the "File name:" field and presses Enter
      6. Focuses back on the "Simulation Wizard" window
      7. Clicks on the "Generate" button to generate the simulation
      8. If a file overwrite confirmation dialog is displayed, clicks "Yes" to replace the file
      9. Waits for the simulation to be generated
      10. Stops the timer for logging the time taken for simulation generation
      11. Clicks on the "No" button to close any additional dialog boxes (if present)
      12. Sets root search to true
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the simulation file to be generated.
      testCaseName - The name of the test case being executed for logging purposes.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while generating the simulation in the Developer Editor.

    • generateCueCard

      public void generateCueCard​(String fileName, String testCaseName)
      Generates a cue card in the Developer Editor and logs data during the process.

      This method generates a cue card in the Developer Editor with the given fileName and testCaseName. It focuses on the Developer Editor window and performs the following steps:

      1. Clicks on the "File" menu and selects "Generate Cue card..."
      2. Focuses on the "Cue card Wizard" window
      3. Clicks on the "Settings" menu and selects "Load Settings..."
      4. Focuses on the "Open" window
      5. Enters the file name in the "File name:" field and presses Enter
      6. Focuses back on the "Cue card Wizard" window
      7. Clicks on the "Generate" button to generate the cue card
      8. If a file overwrite confirmation dialog is displayed, clicks "Yes" to replace the file
      9. Waits for the cue card to be generated
      10. Stops the timer for logging the time taken for cue card generation
      11. Clicks on the "OK" button to close any additional dialog boxes (if present)
      12. Sets root search to true
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the cue card file to be generated.
      testCaseName - The name of the test case being executed for logging purposes.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs while generating the cue card in the Developer Editor.

    • performanceTestDoc

      public void performanceTestDoc​(String captureFileName)
      Performs document files performance testing.

      This method performs performance testing on document files using the Epiplex500 application. It takes the captureFileName as input, which represents the name of the capture file to be used for the performance test. The performance test is divided into the following steps:

      1. Step 1: Finalize the capture from home using the finalizeFromHome(String) method.
      2. Step 2: Generate various documents and simulations using the generateDocument(String, String), generateSimulation(String, String), and generateCueCard(String, String) methods.
      3. Step 3: Close the Developer Editor and Epiplex500 applications using the Application.closeApplication(String) method.
      Parameters:
      captureFileName - The name of the capture file used for performance testing.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the performance test.
